semantic_title: Multiple External Cause Coding Priority Hierarchy and Sequencing Rules
section_path: Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > f. Multiple External Cause Coding Guidelines

content.full_text: More than one external cause code is required to fully describe the external cause of an illness or injury. The assignment of external cause codes should be sequenced in the following priority: If two or more events cause separate injuries, an external cause code should be assigned for each cause. The first-listed external cause code will be selected in the following order: External codes for child and adult abuse take priority over all other external cause codes. See Section I.C.19., Child and Adult abuse guidelines. External cause codes for terrorism events take priority over all other external cause codes except child and adult abuse. External cause codes for cataclysmic events take priority over all other external cause codes except child and adult abuse and terrorism. External cause codes for transport accidents take priority over all other external cause codes except cataclysmic events, child and adult abuse and terrorism. Activity and external cause status codes are assigned following all causal (intent) external cause codes. The first-listed external cause code should correspond to the cause of the most serious diagnosis due to an assault, accident, or self-harm, following the order of hierarchy listed above. (Evidence: pg no: 90, L72-L81)
content.summary: Multiple external cause codes follow a specific priority hierarchy: abuse > terrorism > cataclysmic events > transport accidents > other causes, with activity/status codes last, and first-listed code corresponding to most serious diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 90, L72-L81)
key_concepts: Multiple external cause codes may be required (Evidence: pg no: 90, L72-L73)
Specific priority hierarchy exists (Evidence: pg no: 90, L73-L74)
Child and adult abuse codes have highest priority (Evidence: pg no: 90, L75)
Terrorism codes second priority (Evidence: pg no: 90, L76)
Cataclysmic events third priority (Evidence: pg no: 90, L77)
Transport accidents fourth priority (Evidence: pg no: 90, L78)
Activity and status codes assigned last (Evidence: pg no: 90, L79)
First-listed corresponds to most serious diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 90, L80-L81)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Child and adult abuse codes take priority over all other external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 90, L75)
detailed_rules.explanation: Abuse-related external cause codes have the highest priority in the hierarchy and should be sequenced first when present with other external causes (Evidence: pg no: 90, L75)
detailed_rules.applies_to: Child and adult abuse external cause codes

detailed_rules.rule_text: Terrorism codes take priority over all except child and adult abuse (Evidence: pg no: 90, L76)
detailed_rules.explanation: Terrorism-related external cause codes have second highest priority and should be sequenced first unless abuse codes are also present (Evidence: pg no: 90, L76)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Cataclysmic events take priority over all except abuse and terrorism (Evidence: pg no: 90, L77)
detailed_rules.explanation: Natural disasters and cataclysmic events have third priority in the external cause hierarchy (Evidence: pg no: 90, L77)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Transport accidents take priority over all except cataclysmic events, abuse and terrorism (Evidence: pg no: 90, L78)
detailed_rules.explanation: Transportation-related external cause codes have fourth priority in the hierarchy (Evidence: pg no: 90, L78)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Activity and status codes assigned following all causal (intent) external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 90, L79)
detailed_rules.explanation: Supplementary external cause codes for activity and status are always sequenced after all causal and intent codes regardless of the hierarchy (Evidence: pg no: 90, L79)
detailed_rules.applies_to: Activity and external cause status codes

detailed_rules.rule_text: First-listed external cause corresponds to cause of most serious diagnosis following hierarchy (Evidence: pg no: 90, L80-L81)
detailed_rules.explanation: When multiple external causes are present, the first-listed should correspond to the cause of the most serious diagnosis while still following the established priority hierarchy (Evidence: pg no: 90, L80-L81)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify all external causes contributing to injuries/conditions
Step 2: Apply priority hierarchy: abuse > terrorism > cataclysmic > transport > other
Step 3: Sequence causal/intent codes according to hierarchy
Step 4: Add activity and status codes after all causal codes
Step 5: Verify first-listed corresponds to most serious diagnosis within hierarchy
